guidelines:
SOLUTIONS & BUFFERS:

 

Note: Do not use sodium azide in any buffers or solutions as sodium azide inactivates
the horseradish-peroxidase enzyme.


Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS):
80.0 g NaCl
14.4 g Na2HPO4
2.4 g KH2PO4
2.0 g KCl
Add ddH2O up to 10 L; pH to 7.2 with HCl

 

Coating Buffer:
Can use either Sterile PBS or
Sterile Carbonate Buffer (per ELISA protocol)
8.4 g Na HCO3
3.56 g Na2CO3
Add ddH2O up to 1.0 L, pH to 9.5.

 

PBS-Tween:
0.05% Tween-20 in PBS
(500 μl Tween-20 in 1L PBS)

 

Blocking Buffer (PBS-BSA):
1% BSA in PBS
(10 g BSA-Fraction V in 1L PBS)

 

PBS-Tween-BSA:
1% BSA in PBS-Tween
(10 g BSA-Fraction V in 1L PBS-Tween)

 

Tissue Culture (TC) Medium:
As appropriate for cells being analyzed

 

AEC Solution:
100 mg AEC (3-amino-9-ethyl-carbazole) in 10 ml DMF
(N,N, Dimethylformamide)
Solution should be prepared in a glass tube in a fume hood.

 

AEC Buffer:
(0.1 M Acetate): 148 ml 0.2 M acetic acid (11.55 ml glacial acetic acid per liter of
water) and 352 ml of 0.2 M sodium acetate (27.2 g per liter of water)
Bring up to 1L with water and adjust to pH 5.0 if required

 

Substrate Solution:
800 μl AEC solution in 24 ml AEC buffer
Filter with 0.45 μm filter and add 12 μl 30% H2O2
Use immediately

components.data:
Dilute Low-Endotoxin/Azide-Free sterile unlabeled capture antibody (BioLegend’sLEAF™ format antibodies are specifically designed for this assay) to a final concentration of 0.5–4 μg/ml in sterile Coating Buffer and transfer 100μl/well to a high affinity binding PVDF membrane ELISPOT plate (e.g., Millipore;Cat. No. MAIPS-4510).

 

Note: BioLegend's LEAF™ and Ultra-LEAF™ format antibodies are specifically designed for this assay
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Dilute Low-Endotoxin/Azide-Free sterile unlabeled capture antibody (BioLegend’sLEAF™ format antibodies are specifically designed for this assay) to a final concentration of 0.5–4 μg/ml in sterile Coating Buffer and transfer 100μl/well to a high affinity binding PVDF membrane ELISPOT plate (e.g., Millipore;Cat. No. MAIPS-4510).

 

Note: BioLegend's LEAF™ and Ultra-LEAF™ format antibodies are specifically designed for this assay

components.data: Store plates overnight in humidified box at 4°C or at 37°C for ≥ 4 hours inhumidified atmosphere.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store plates overnight in humidified box at 4°C or at 37°C for ≥ 4 hours inhumidified atmosphere.

components.data: Wash the plate 3 times with 200 µl/well of sterile PBS, gently tapping plates dry on a clean paper towel between each wash.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the plate 3 times with 200 µl/well of sterile PBS, gently tapping plates dry on a clean paper towel between each wash.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of ELISPOT Protocol
source_data.annotation:
1. Since ELISPOT plates are more delicate than ELISA plates, they should be gently tapped and washed manually.
  2. Do not use an automatic plate washer, since this could compromise the integrity of the PVDF membrane.
source_data.thread_text:
1. Since ELISPOT plates are more delicate than ELISA plates, they should be gently tapped and washed manually.
  2. Do not use an automatic plate washer, since this could compromise the integrity of the PVDF membrane.
source_data.body:
1. Since ELISPOT plates are more delicate than ELISA plates, they should be gently tapped and washed manually.
  2. Do not use an automatic plate washer, since this could compromise the integrity of the PVDF membrane.

components.data: Add 200 μl/well of sterile Blocking Buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 200 μl/well of sterile Blocking Buffer.

components.data: Seal plate and incubate at room temperature for ≥ 1 hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal plate and incubate at room temperature for ≥ 1 hour.
Repeat step 5

components.data: Add 100µl/well of appropriate sterile antigen or mitogen solution diluted in appropriate sterile tissue culture (TC) medium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100µl/well of appropriate sterile antigen or mitogen solution diluted in appropriate sterile tissue culture (TC) medium.

components.data: Set-Up Tissue Culture and Add Antigen or Mitogen
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Set-Up Tissue Culture and Add Antigen or Mitogen

components.data: Add 100µl/well of cells diluted in sterile TC medium. Use 5 x 104 to 5 x 105cells/well
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100µl/well of cells diluted in sterile TC medium. Use 5 x 104 to 5 x 105cells/well

components.data: Set-Up Tissue Culture and Add Antigen or Mitogen
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Set-Up Tissue Culture and Add Antigen or Mitogen

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 10 of ELISPOT Protocol
source_data.annotation:
1. The minimum number of cells should be determined in preliminary experiments.
  2. When determining the optimal number of cells to use, keep in mind the expected levels of expression of the target protein. If the expression is expected to be low, use a higher number of cells.
  3. If the cells can withstand the environment, use a serum-free media. Serum contains proteins that can affect results or give a high background or nonspecific signal.
source_data.thread_text:
1. The minimum number of cells should be determined in preliminary experiments.
  2. When determining the optimal number of cells to use, keep in mind the expected levels of expression of the target protein. If the expression is expected to be low, use a higher number of cells.
  3. If the cells can withstand the environment, use a serum-free media. Serum contains proteins that can affect results or give a high background or nonspecific signal.
source_data.body:
1. The minimum number of cells should be determined in preliminary experiments.
  2. When determining the optimal number of cells to use, keep in mind the expected levels of expression of the target protein. If the expression is expected to be low, use a higher number of cells.
  3. If the cells can withstand the environment, use a serum-free media. Serum contains proteins that can affect results or give a high background or nonspecific signal.

components.data: Seal plate and incubate at 37°C 5% CO2 in humidified atmosphere for the optimum stimulation period.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal plate and incubate at 37°C 5% CO2 in humidified atmosphere for the optimum stimulation period.

components.data: Set-Up Tissue Culture and Add Antigen or Mitogen
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Set-Up Tissue Culture and Add Antigen or Mitogen

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 11 of ELISPOT Protocol
source_data.annotation:
1. BioLegend recommends a 24 hour incubation for IFNγ, IL-2, and TNFα; and a 48 hour incubation for IL-4, IL-5, and IL-10 for most activation conditions.
  2. Do not shake or move the plates while the cells are culturing. This will lead to spots that are not well-defined.
  3. If your cells take more than 48 hours to respond to stimulation, they can be treated with the stimulant in a separate 96-well plate prior to transferring to the ELISPOT plat
source_data.thread_text:
1. BioLegend recommends a 24 hour incubation for IFNγ, IL-2, and TNFα; and a 48 hour incubation for IL-4, IL-5, and IL-10 for most activation conditions.
  2. Do not shake or move the plates while the cells are culturing. This will lead to spots that are not well-defined.
  3. If your cells take more than 48 hours to respond to stimulation, they can be treated with the stimulant in a separate 96-well plate prior to transferring to the ELISPOT plat
source_data.body:
1. BioLegend recommends a 24 hour incubation for IFNγ, IL-2, and TNFα; and a 48 hour incubation for IL-4, IL-5, and IL-10 for most activation conditions.
  2. Do not shake or move the plates while the cells are culturing. This will lead to spots that are not well-defined.
  3. If your cells take more than 48 hours to respond to stimulation, they can be treated with the stimulant in a separate 96-well plate prior to transferring to the ELISPOT plat

source_data.description: Wash plate 3 times with PBS, 200 μl/well.

components.data:
Wash plate 3 times with PBS-Tween, 200 μl/well.

 

Note: Tween-20 is included in the wash buffer to aid detachment of any cells that have attached during overnight cell culture.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Wash plate 3 times with PBS-Tween, 200 μl/well.

 

Note: Tween-20 is included in the wash buffer to aid detachment of any cells that have attached during overnight cell culture.

components.data: Add 100 μl/well of diluted biotinylated detection antibody at 0.25-2 μg/ml inPBS-Tween-BSA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100 μl/well of diluted biotinylated detection antibody at 0.25-2 μg/ml inPBS-Tween-BSA.

components.data: Seal the plate and incubate at 4°C overnight, or 2 hr at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal the plate and incubate at 4°C overnight, or 2 hr at room temperature.

components.data: Wash plate 4 times with PBS-Tween, 200 μl/well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash plate 4 times with PBS-Tween, 200 μl/well.

components.data: Add 100 μl per well of the Av-HRP conjugate (Cat. No. 405103) or otherenzyme conjugate diluted to its pre-determined optimal concentration inPBS-Tween-BSA (usually between 1/500 – 1/2000).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100 μl per well of the Av-HRP conjugate (Cat. No. 405103) or otherenzyme conjugate diluted to its pre-determined optimal concentration inPBS-Tween-BSA (usually between 1/500 – 1/2000).

components.data: Seal the plate and incubate at room temperature for 1 – 2 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal the plate and incubate at room temperature for 1 – 2 hours.
Wash plate 3 times with PBS-Tween, 200 μl/well.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 19 of ELISPOT Protocol
source_data.annotation: Take the base off of the bottom of the plate to ensure it is thoroughly washed. This will help prevent high background, since some reagents can leak through the PVDF membrane and stick to the base or bottom of the plate
source_data.thread_text: Take the base off of the bottom of the plate to ensure it is thoroughly washed. This will help prevent high background, since some reagents can leak through the PVDF membrane and stick to the base or bottom of the plate
source_data.body: Take the base off of the bottom of the plate to ensure it is thoroughly washed. This will help prevent high background, since some reagents can leak through the PVDF membrane and stick to the base or bottom of the plate

components.data: Wash plate 3 times with PBS, 200 μl/well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash plate 3 times with PBS, 200 μl/well.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 20 of ELISPOT Protocol
source_data.annotation: • When you are done washing, be sure to replace the base to the bottom of the plate.
source_data.thread_text: • When you are done washing, be sure to replace the base to the bottom of the plate.
source_data.body: • When you are done washing, be sure to replace the base to the bottom of the plate.

source_data.description: Add 200 μl/well of fresh Substrate solution.

components.data: Monitor spot/color development at room temperature and stop reaction by rinsing plate with tap water and vigorously flicking plate over a waste container or sink, followed by blotting on paper towels or other absorbent materials.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Monitor spot/color development at room temperature and stop reaction by rinsing plate with tap water and vigorously flicking plate over a waste container or sink, followed by blotting on paper towels or other absorbent materials.

components.data: Air dry plate overnight, until it is completely dry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Air dry plate overnight, until it is completely dry.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 23 of ELISPOT Protocol
source_data.annotation: • Spots could become sharper if the plates are stored overnight at 4°C. Wrap plates in foil prior to storing.
source_data.thread_text: • Spots could become sharper if the plates are stored overnight at 4°C. Wrap plates in foil prior to storing.
source_data.body: • Spots could become sharper if the plates are stored overnight at 4°C. Wrap plates in foil prior to storing.

components.data: Count spots manually with a dissecting microscope or using an automated image acquisition/analysis unit (plates can be analyzed for up to 3 months).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Count spots manually with a dissecting microscope or using an automated image acquisition/analysis unit (plates can be analyzed for up to 3 months).

components.data: Prepare the PVDF membrane 96-well ELISPOT plates (e.g., Millipore Cat. No. MAIPS-4510) by soaking them in 35% ethanol for 30 seconds.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare the PVDF membrane 96-well ELISPOT plates (e.g., Millipore Cat. No. MAIPS-4510) by soaking them in 35% ethanol for 30 seconds.

components.data:
Wash thoroughly with PBS to remove any residual ethanol.

Note: Ethanol can negatively affect cell viability and antibody binding.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Wash thoroughly with PBS to remove any residual ethanol.

Note: Ethanol can negatively affect cell viability and antibody binding.
